comments:
Enviroment:
Eclipse 3.0 + CDT 2.0 build 20040820
Using standard make project.
And IBM Visual Age 3.5 compiler.
Project has about 5 source files and ~40 includes
Content assistant is set to 8 seconds

Problem:
When content assistant is trigerred eclipse for 5 seconds uses 100% cpu and 
terminates, without saving edited files.

Log file content:
!SESSION Rgp 20, 2004 11:35:12.421 ---------------------------------------------
eclipse.buildId=I200406251208
java.version=1.5.0-beta2
java.vendor=Sun Microsystems Inc.
BootLoader constants: OS=win32, ARCH=x86, WS=win32, NL=lt_LT

!ENTRY org.eclipse.ui 4 4 Rgp 20, 2004 11:35:12.421
!MESSAGE Unhandled event loop exception

!ENTRY org.eclipse.ui 4 4 Rgp 20, 2004 11:35:15.359
!MESSAGE Unhandled event loop exception

!ENTRY org.eclipse.ui 4 0 Rgp 20, 2004 11:35:15.359
!MESSAGE Java heap space
!STACK 0
java.lang.OutOfMemoryError: Java heap space

!ENTRY org.eclipse.ui 4 4 Rgp 20, 2004 11:35:18.171
!MESSAGE Save All Failed

!ENTRY org.eclipse.ui 2 0 Rgp 20, 2004 11:35:18.171
!MESSAGE Save All Failed
!STACK 0
java.lang.OutOfMemoryError: Java heap space

!ENTRY org.eclipse.osgi Rgp 20, 2004 11:35:23.500
!MESSAGE Application error
!STACK 1
java.lang.OutOfMemoryError: Java heap space

You will have to provide me with some source code to reproduce the problem.  
I do not see the same behaviour using 40 STL/Standard Library inclusions.  
Please reply, I want to know whether or not this should gate 2.0.1.

I am used code assistant for IString class from IBM Visual Age 3.5 library
When I set content assistant timeout to 5 seconds it timesout and that behavior 
did not apears. And If i set timeout to 8 or 10 seconds and use content 
assistant eclipse terminates.
The source code of CDT is taken from HEAD today of CDT CVS compiled by using 
Export->Deployable features.
I can not provide source code because it is copyrighted.
Without a code example, I cannot look into this in the near timeframe.

I have some info for my project with the build one week or two before i can not 
make content assistant to come up with the results when i set timeout for it 
for 10 minutes.

And I done some investigation that if i do simple project with only istring.hpp 
included i get other problems with invalid content given from content assistant 
and indexer errors. Also content assistant comes up with results in 5 seconds.
If you want I can send you that simple project for your futher investigation.

turn on follow #icludes from Window->Preferences and look at the outline for 
a.cpp file in the attached project.

I found another thing that maybe matter here that in my workspace there is 16 
projects 1 of them is java, and 2 of them is resource projects, and others are 
C++ projects. 9 of them are closed and 7 are opened.

Pushing this off to Future. 
IString is part of visual age libraries.  
We have not yet done that port.

If I want to add that sopport for IBM VA where I should start looking:
1. Some classes where that difference is between other compilers.
2. Which projects should be looked. (only scanner or something more?)
3. Some Hints.

Thank you. ;)

I tested this PR on 20040826 build and I _can_not_ reproduce it.
And as I see CDT got better now I don't have to wait for ages for context 
assistant to come up. It is enough 10 seconds for that.
Nice work thanx!

the main thing which coused this problem was 1.5.0 JRE which I used to run 
Eclipse. When switched to 1.4.2 all works fine.

Sorry, for the previous posts It seems to early to be happy.
The problem still apprear and I found some new info about it:

time out is set to 10 seconds.
I used content assistant 2 time by pressing CTRL+SPACE to invoke it for both 
times I got No completions available.
So I typed symbols "Id" and after that i invoked external build tools and after 
build completion heep size to small message box appeared It asked to close 
eclipse I pressed No on it. And After pressing No button in status bar appeared 
text "Content assistant parsing has timed out."

It looks like you were running into Out of Memory errors.

At any rate, content assist has been rewritten in CDT 4.0. Please give it a try (although we're almost three years later...)
